intro: Pilosocereus sublanatus, commonly known as the Moon Cactus, is a cactus species native to Mexico. It is characterized by its swollen, rounded stem that resembles a moon, hence its common name. The plant has a distinctive appearance with a dense covering of white or pale blue spines. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique shape and color. The species is adapted to arid environments, thriving in well-drained soil and full sun.
